template.description: Allows you to turn any Corona display object into a simulated physical object with one line of code, including the assignment of physical properties.
template.name: physics.addBody

template.description: Returns the x,y components of the global gravity vector, in units of m/s2. This takes advantage of the fact that Lua functions can return multiple values.
template.name: physics.getGravity

template.description: Joints are used to assemble more complex game objects from multiple rigid bodes. To construct a joint, first construct the bodies that will be joined, and then call this method with the desired joint constructor type.
template.name: physics.newJoint

template.description: Removes a physics body from a display object without destroying the entire object. This removes the body created with physics.addBody.
template.name: physics.removeBody

template.description: Selects one of three possible rendering modes for the physics engine. This mode may be changed at any time -- see the "DebugDraw" sample project for an example of how to toggle it on the fly.
template.name: physics.setDrawMode

template.description: Sets the x,y components of the global gravity vector, in units of m/s2. The default is ( 0, 9.8 ) to simulate standard Earth gravity, pointing downwards on the y-axis.
template.name: physics.setGravity

template.description: Sets the accuracy of the engine's position calculations.
template.name: physics.setPositionIterations

template.description: Sets the internal pixels-per-meter ratio that is used in converting between onscreen Corona coordinates and simulated physics coordinates. This should be done only once, before any physical objects are instantiated.
template.name: physics.setScale

template.description: Sets the accuracy of the engine's velocity calculations.
template.name: physics.setVelocityIterations

template.description: This function start the physics simulation and should be called before any other physics functions.
template.name: physics.start
